tool_description:
Unlock the Power of Real-Time Forex Insights with Our Forex Factory Scraper API ! Harness the invaluable data from https://www.forexfactory.com to supercharge your trading strategies and analysis.

Have questions or need assistance? Chat with us live on Discord: https://discord.gg/pu2saW8uY8
name: Forex Factory Scraper
title: Forex Factory Scraper

api_list.name: Get Historical Calendar Details
api_list.description: The Forex Factory Scraper API provides users with real-time financial event data directly from the Forex Factory website https://www.forexfactory.com. Covering events from 2007 to 2023, users can extract key insights for multiple global currencies. Ideal for traders and analysts, this tool delivers detailed event context, expected market impact, and expert notes, all seamlessly integrated via Rapid API for informed trading decisions and market understanding.

required_parameters.name: currency
required_parameters.description: To represent currencies, provide the currency code as a string parameter. The list of supported currency codes includes: \"GBP\" (British Pound Sterling), \"CHF\" (Swiss Franc), \"CAD\" (Canadian Dollar), \"CNY\" (Chinese Yuan), \"EUR\" (Euro), \"NZD\" (New Zealand Dollar), \"JPY\" (Japanese Yen), \"AUD\" (Australian Dollar), \"USD\" (United States Dollar), and \"ALL\" (All Currencies).

api_list.name: Get Real Time Calendar Details
api_list.description: This endpoint facilitates the scraping and retrieval of real-time calendar details for various calendar types, including Forex, Metal, Energy, and Crypto, from their respective websites. It gathers essential information for each event, such as the event date, year, time, currency, impact level, event name, actual value, forecast value, and previous value. Additionally, it constructs a link to access the open details of each event.

required_parameters.name: currency
required_parameters.description: To represent currencies, provide the currency code as a string parameter. The list of supported currency codes includes: \"GBP\" (British Pound Sterling), \"CHF\" (Swiss Franc), \"CAD\" (Canadian Dollar), \"CNY\" (Chinese Yuan), \"EUR\" (Euro), \"NZD\" (New Zealand Dollar), \"JPY\" (Japanese Yen), \"AUD\" (Australian Dollar), \"USD\" (United States Dollar), and \"ALL\" (All Currencies).

required_parameters.name: timezone
required_parameters.description:
To represent timezones, provide the timezone in the format 'GMT+01:00 Paris' or 'GMT-06:00 Central Time (US & Canada)' as a string parameter. Examples of valid offsets include:

- 'GMT-11:00 International Date Line West, Midway Island'
- 'GMT-11:00 American Samoa'
- 'GMT-10:00 Hawaii'
- 'GMT-10:00 Aleutian Islands'
- 'GMT-09:00 Alaska'

api_list.name: Forex Industry News / Latest Stories
api_list.description: Access forex industry news titles, links, impact, sources, source links, publication times, and article previews to keep up with developments in the foreign exchange market.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://forex-factory-scraper1.p.rapidapi.com/latest_forex_industry_news"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "forex-factory-scraper1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Trades Positions
api_list.description: This endpoint enables real-time web scraping of Forex trading position data from the ForexFactory website. It collects comprehensive information for various trading instruments, including the count and percentage of long and short traders. Additionally, it provides a link to access detailed position data for each instrument. The extracted data is structured and delivered as a list of dictionaries for seamless integration and analysis. In case of scraping errors, the endpoint returns an empty list.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://forex-factory-scraper1.p.rapidapi.com/trades_positions"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "forex-factory-scraper1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Trades Leaderboard
api_list.description: This endpoint facilitates the real-time scraping and retrieval of Forex trading leaderboard data from the ForexFactory website. It extracts essential information such as rank, explorer details, return values, trader names, and trader profile URLs. The scraped data is structured and provided as a list of dictionaries for seamless integration and analysis. In case of scraping errors, the endpoint returns an empty list.

It gathers comprehensive details for each trade event, including trade information, trader details, return, and pips. api_list.name: Get Forums
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to scrape and retrieve data about various forums on ForexFactory. It sends a GET request to the ForexFactory forums page, extracts details such as the forum name, forum link, thread count, and reply count for each forum, and returns this information as a list of forum objects. Use this endpoint to gather insights into the forums available on ForexFactory.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://forex-factory-scraper1.p.rapidapi.com/forums"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "forex-factory-scraper1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Forum Details
api_list.description:
This endpoint is responsible for scraping and extracting details from a specific forum page on ForexFactory. It takes three parameters: forum_link, order, and sort. The forum_link parameter is the URL of the forum to be scraped, while order and sort are used to specify the order and sorting criteria for the forum's threads. The endpoint retrieves the HTML content of the forum page, processes it, and extracts relevant information, including thread details, user leads, last reply, reply previews, and reply counts.

Parameters:

forum_link (str): The URL of the forum to be scraped.
order (str): The order in which threads are displayed (e.g., "asc" or "desc").
sort (str): The sorting criteria for threads (e.g., "replycount" or "lastpost").

Response:

Returns a list of ForumThread objects containing the extracted data from the forum page.

api_list.name: Get Forum Thread Details
api_list.description:
This endpoint is responsible for scraping and extracting details from a specific forum thread page. It takes a thread_link parameter, which is the URL of the thread to be scraped. The endpoint retrieves the HTML content of the thread page, processes it, and extracts relevant information such as user posts, usernames, profile links, posting date and time, post content, and attachments if available.

Parameters:
thread_link (str): The URL of the forum thread to be scraped.

Response:
Returns a list of ThreadPost objects containing the extracted data from the thread page.
